REST API repository Comments¶

async src.repository.comments.add_comment(image_id: int, body: CommentBase, db: Session, user: User) → Comment¶

Adds a new comment to the database.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Identify the image that the comment is being added to

  • body – CommentBase: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the logged-in user

Returns:

A comment object

async src.repository.comments.delete_comment(comment_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → None¶

Deletes a comment from the database. The comment can be deleted by Admin and Moderator

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Identify the comment to be deleted

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is Admin or Moderator and authorized to delete a comment

Returns:

The comment that was deleted

async src.repository.comments.edit_comment(comment_id: int, body: CommentBase, db: Session, user: User) → Comment | None¶

Allows a user to edit their own comment.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Find the comment in the database

  • body – CommentBase: Pass the data from the request body to this function

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is an admin, moderator or the author of the comment

Returns:

A comment object

async src.repository.comments.get_comment_by_id(comment_id: int, db: Session, user: User) → Comment | None¶

Returns a comment from the database by comment_id.

Parameters:

  • comment_id – int: Specify the id of the comment that we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to see comment

Returns:

The comment with the given id, if it exists

async src.repository.comments.get_comments_by_user_id(user_id: int, db: Session) → List[Comment] | None¶

Returns a list of comments made by the user with the given id. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the user_id of the user whose comments we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of comments

async src.repository.comments.get_image_comments(image_id: int, db: Session) → List[Comment]¶

Returns a list of comments for the specified image_id.

Parameters:

  • image_id – int: Filter the comments by image_id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of comments for a given image

async src.repository.comments.get_user_comments_by_image(user_id: int, image_id: int, db: Session) → List[Comment] | None¶

Returns a list of comments for a given user and image.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Filter the comments by user_id

  • image_id – int: Filter the comments by image_id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of comments, or none if the user doesn’t exist

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

REST API routes Authentication¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular User object

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message if the email is already confirmed or confirms the email and returns a message that it has been confirmed

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies them against the database, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A dict with access_token, refresh_token and token_type

async src.routes.auth.logout(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the http request

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already an unconfirmed account associated with that email address, and if so it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message that will be shown to the user

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using Argon2 and stored in the database. An email with an activation link is sent to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the request body and convert it to a UserModel object

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A UserModel object

REST API routes Pictures¶

async src.routes.pictures.create_image(description: str, tags: str = None, image_file: UploadFile = File(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_image function creates a new image in the database. It takes a description and an image file as input. The image file is uploaded to Cloudinary and the url is stored in the database.

Parameters:

  • description – str: The description of the image

  • tags – TagModelAddToPicture: 5 tags

  • image_file – UploadFile: The image file

  • current_user – User: The user object

  • db – Session: A connection to our Postgres SQL database.

Returns:

A image object

REST API routes Users¶

Returns:

banned user info with message of success

Return type:

dict

async src.routes.users.make_role_by_email(body: RequestRole, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The make_role_by_email function is used to change the role of a user.

The function takes in an email and a role, and changes the user’s role to that specified by the inputted parameters. If no such user exists, then an HTTPException is raised with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid Email&quot;. If the new role matches that of the current one, then a message saying so will be returned. Otherwise, if all goes well, then a success message will be returned.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestRole: Get the email and role from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with a message key

async src.routes.users.read_all_users(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The read_all_users function returns a list of users.

— get:

summary: Returns all users. description: This can only be done by the logged in user. operationId: read_all_users parameters:

  • name: skip (optional) # The number of records to skip before returning results, default is 0 (no records skipped). Used for pagination purposes. See https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/cursor.skip/#cursor-skip-examples for more information on how this

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n records

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A list of users

REST API service Auth¶

Модуль який відповідає за всі операції поа’язані з авторизацією користувача Функціонал: 1. Хешування паролю 2. Звірення хешованого паролю з введенним 3. Створення access, email verification і refresh токенів 4. Декодування refresh токену 5. Отримання поточного юзера 6. Отримання email з токена підтвердження

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async blocklist(token)¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
Creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Data:

dict: Pass the data to be encoded

Expires_delta:

Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the access token

Returns:

A jwt token

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

Takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Data:

dict: Pass in the data to be encoded

Returns:

A token

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
Creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Data:

dict: Pass the user’s data to be encoded

Expires_delta:

Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded with the user’s id, username and email

credentials_exception = HTTPException(status_code=401, detail='Could not validate credentials')¶
async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

Decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Refresh_token:

str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their access token

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Function is a dependency that will be used in the UserRouter class. It takes in a token and db session, and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Token:

str: Pass the token to the function

Db:

Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The user that is currently logged in

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

Takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. If it does, we return the email from its payload. If not, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message ‘Invalid scope for token’. If there is any other error in decoding or validating the JWT (such as if it’s expired), we raise an HTTPException with status code 422 (Unprocessable entity) and detail message ‘Invalid token for email verification’.

Token:

str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email from the token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

Takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

Password:

str: Receive the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hashed password

is_blocklisted(jti)¶
oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
required_auth_with_email(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer))¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments.

Plain_password:

Pass in the password entered by the user

Hashed_password:

Compare the hashed password stored in the database with a new plain text password that is entered by a user

Returns:

True if the password is correct

REST API service Cloud Images¶

class src.services.cloud_image.CloudImage¶

Bases: object

The CloudImage class is a wrapper around the Cloudinary API. It provides methods to upload, edit and delete images.

Parameters:

  • cloud_name – str: The name of the cloudinary account

  • api_key – str: The api key of the cloudinary account

  • api_secret – str: The api secret of the cloudinary account

  • secure – bool: Whether to use https or not

static generate_name_image()¶

The generate_name_image function generates a random name for the image. It uses the uuid4 function to generate a random string and then hashes it using sha256.

Returns:

A random string

static get_url_for_image(file_name)¶

The get_url_for_image function gets the url for an image.

Parameters:

file_name – The name of the image

Returns:

The url of the image

static upload(file, public_id: str, overwrite=True)¶

The upload function uploads an image to Cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • file – The image file

  • public_id – The name of the image

  • overwrite – Whether to overwrite the image or not

Returns:

The response from Cloudinary

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address that they entered when signing up for an account. -username: str, the username of the user who is trying to sign up for an account. This will be used in conjunction with host (see below) and token_verification (see below) as part of a URL that will be sent via email to verify their identity and allow them to access into our application.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object
